intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. septentrionora, commonly known as the Northern Aculeate Conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, aculeate (spiny) leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense spikes, often in shades of purple or pink. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This subspecies is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystem.
